# create_treemap_figure { #tame_your_files.create_treemap_figure }

```python
create_treemap_figure(data)
```

Transforms the flat list into a Plotly Treemap object.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name   | Type         | Description                                                                             | Default    |
|--------|--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| data   | list of dict | The list of dictionaries representing files and folders with their sizes and hierarchy. | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type                        | Description                                                   |
|--------|-----------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
|        | plotly.graph_objects.Figure | A Plotly Treemap figure representing the directory structure. |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> fig = create_treemap_figure([{"id": "root", "name": "root", "parent": "", "value": 0}])
>>> fig.__class__.__name__
'Figure'
```
